page.title: 05FLEET RAILWAY STATION
page.content:
Fleet Station caters mostly for commuters, with about 3,000 travelling to London each day, at a cost of almost Â£1,000 p.a.
{Commuting to Work} Every day my Dad commutes to London. He gets up at 6.30 and, after breakfast, cycles to the station. Once there, he rushes to his spot on the platform to catch the 7.25 to Waterloo. He tries to get a 'non-smoker' carriage, often he cannot even get a seat so has to stand. His office is 20 minutes walk away. If it rains he catches a bus. The journey home is worse as he is always tired and often gets a headache. If he is lucky, he is home by 6.30 p.m. If not, he eats his tea by himself. He does not like commuting.
